body_html:
Max said:

On your question about the foreign key: if I recall correctly it once was in place, but not used or only being set if manually done via a "hidden" form 😉 But I don't remember any details on why it is no longer there. It probably has to do with the projects' IDs only being part of the application_data htstore...

The project_id was removed with the introduction of the Projects Proposal feature, here:
7bcef84.
body_text:
Max said:

On your question about the foreign key: if I recall correctly it once was in place, but not used or only being set if manually done via a "hidden" form 😉 But I don't remember any details on why it is no longer there. It probably has to do with the projects' IDs only being part of the application_data htstore...

The project_id was removed with the introduction of the Projects Proposal feature, here:
7bcef84.
body:
Max said:
> On your question about the foreign key: if I recall correctly it once was in place, but not used or only being set if manually done via a "hidden" form 😉 But I don't remember any details on why it is no longer there. It probably has to do with the projects' IDs only being part of the application_data htstore...

The project_id was removed with the introduction of the Projects Proposal feature, here: 
https://github.com/rails-girls-summer-of-code/rgsoc-teams/commit/7bcef84b42c13858a4cb106a8cab22f42dab6a59.
